qas.question: With the right tools, what area could get free BBC broadcasts from Astra 2D?
What are some entities that have taken issue with the possibility that BBC programming was being viewed for free?
On what service were some shows removed as a result of issues over rights?
What are two specific broadcasts suspended on Sky Digital?

answers.text: Scottish Premier League and Scottish Cup football

qas.question: What was smaller than the footprint of the Astra 2D satellite?

plausible_answers.text: concern about the unencrypted signal leaking out.

qas.question: What concerns with Western Europe did "free-to-air" bring up?
What happened to some programs on the Digital Sky Platform?

context: While the "footprint" of the Astra 2D satellite was smaller than that of <b4_0>Astra 2A<b4_0/>, from which it was previously broadcast encrypted, it meant that viewers with appropriate equipment were able to receive BBC channels "free-to-air" over much of <a0_0>Western Europe<a0_0/>. Consequently, some rights concerns have needed to be resolved with programme providers such as <a1_0>Hollywood studios and sporting organisations<a1_0/>, which have expressed <b5_0>concern about the unencrypted signal leaking out.<b5_0/> This led to <b6_0>some broadcasts being made unavailable<b6_0/> on the <a2_0>Sky Digital<a2_0/> platform, such as <a3_0>Scottish Premier League and Scottish Cup football<a3_0/>, while on other platforms such broadcasts were not disrupted. Later, when rights contracts were renewed, this problem was resolved.
